meanings.definition: To look or peer with the eyes partly closed, as in bright sunlight.
meanings.sent1: The sun was so bright that she had to squinny to see properly.
meanings.sent2: He tends to squinny whenever he looks directly at the light.
meanings.sent3: The little girl squinnied at the sun, making a funny face.
meanings.sent4: She squinnied at the horizon, trying to make out the shapes in the distance.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they squinnied to catch a last glimpse of the view.

meanings.sent1: The squinny in the photo looked adorable with his eyes half-closed.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a squinny in the crowd, trying to read a distant sign.
meanings.sent3: The little squinny always made everyone laugh with his funny expressions.
meanings.sent4: He was a squinny when it came to reading small print, always struggling.
meanings.sent5: The old man, a squinny, had a wise look in his partially closed eyes.
